Docs.param: The maximum elapsed time that the Job may run, measured from the time the Job is created.
The maximum number of times each Task may be retried. The Batch service retries a Task if its exit code is nonzero.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JobConstraints class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxTaskRetryCount As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxTaskRetryCount : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times each Task may be retried. The Batch service retries a Task if its exit code is nonzero.
Docs.remarks: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries. The Batch service will try each Task once, and may then retry up to this limit. For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries a Task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries). If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry Tasks. If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries Tasks without limit. The default value is 0 (no retries).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxWallClockTime As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.MaxWallClockTime : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum elapsed time that the Job may run, measured from the time the Job is created.
Docs.remarks: If the Job does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it and any Tasks that are still running. In this case, the termination reason will be MaxWallClockTimeExpiry. If this property is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the Job may run.
